prompt: Facts: On 20.01.1990, in the evening, Venkatamma (aged 8 years), the deceased victim, went out to answer nature's call near Gollarahatti, Hiriyur Taluk, Chitradurga District, Karnataka.; The accused, Krishnappa, allegedly followed her, caught hold of her, took her to a secluded place near a 'jali' tree.; The accused allegedly committed rape upon the victim.; The accused allegedly inflicted injuries on the victim, including biting her cheek and throttling her neck.; The victim returned home crying, injured and bleeding.; Upon inquiry by her mother, Parvathamma (PW-1), and grandmother, Thippamma (PW-2), the victim stated that Krishnappa (the accused) had committed rape on her and caused injuries.; The victim was taken to the Government Hospital at Hiriyur the same evening.; Dr. B.G. Patil (PW-11) examined the victim and found injuries consistent with rape and assault (including teeth marks on the cheek, abrasions on the neck, injury to private parts).; A complaint (Ex. P-10) was lodged by PW-1 based on the victim's statement.; The victim's statement was formally recorded by the police Sub-Inspector (Ex. P-11) in the hospital, treated as a dying declaration, wherein she reiterated naming Krishnappa as the assailant.; The victim succumbed to her injuries on 22.01.1990.; Post-mortem examination confirmed injuries consistent with the prosecution's case.; The Trial Court acquitted the accused, disbelieving the dying declaration primarily due to lack of medical certification regarding the victim's state of mind at the time of recording Ex. P-11 and lack of independent corroboration.; The High Court of Karnataka upheld the acquittal.; The State of Karnataka appealed to the Supreme Court against the acquittal. | IPC: Section 376 (Rape), Section 302 (Murder)
